parts.name: Right atrium
function: Receives venous blood from the whole body
Pumps it to the right ventricle through the right atrioventricular or tricuspid opening.

upper_end.name: Sulcus terminalis
upper_end.passage: Superior venacava to the inferior venacava

parts.name: Smooth posterior part

tributaries.name: Venae cordis minimae
about: It is numerous small veins present in the walls of all the four chambers.
They open into the right atrium through small foramina.

parts.derived_from: Right horn of the sinus venosus

parts.name: Fossa ovalis

margin.name: Annulus ovalis
margin.distinct: Above and sides of the fossa ovalis
margin.represents: Lower free edge of the septum secundum
margin.anterior_edge: Continuous with the left end of the valve of the inferior vena cava

remains_of.name: Foramen ovale
remains_of.location: Upper part of the fossa and the limbus

parts.represents: Site of the embryonic septum primum

introduction.function: pump blood to various parts of the body to meet their nutritive requirement
placement: obliquely behind the body of the sternum and adjoining parts of the costal cartilages
1/3 to the right of the median plane
2/3 to the left of the median plane
introduction.definition: The heart is a conical hollow muscular organ situated in the middle mediastinum

direction_of_blood_flow.from atria to ventricles: downwards, forwards and to the left

parts.name: Atrioventricular groove
about: On the surface of heart, atria and ventricles are separated by Atrioventricular groove.

parts.name: Right atrioventricular groove
parts.function: Separates right atrium from the right ventricle

parts.name: Interatrial groove
about: On the surface of heart, Atria are separated from each other by an Interatrial groove.

parts.name: Interventricular groove
about: On the surface of heart, Ventricles are separated from each other by Interventricular groove.

parts.name: Apex
location: 9 cm lateral to the midsternal line
Just medial to the midclavicular line
parts.orientation: Downwards, forwards and to the left
parts.overlapped_by: Anterior border of the left lung
clinical_significance: Pulsations is seen and felt over this region in living subject

parts.name: Base
relation: Openings of 4 pulmonary veins which open into the left atrium
Openings of Superior and Inferior venacava which open into the right atrium

parts.name: Left lateral surface
relation: Upper part crossed by the coronary sulcus

parts.name: Left border
parts.clinical_significance: separates the anterior and left surfaces of the heart

parts.name: Right border
parts.extends: Superior venacava to inferior vena cava

parts.name: Inferior border
formed_by: Small part near the apex by left ventricle

parts.name: Crux of the Heart
parts.description: Meeting point of interatrial, atrioventricular and posterior interventricular grooves

features: Atria lie above and behind the ventricles.
On the surface of heart, atria and ventricles are separated by Atriventricular groove.
On the surface of heart, Atria are separated from each other by an Interatrial groove.
On the surface of heart, Ventricles are separated from each other by Interventricular groove.
